posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Well I thought I would try again at making another 'spellsword', but this time a druid dex based one.


I thought I could exploit take advantage make use of the synergy between the extraordinary disabling spells of the druid, sneak attack of the rogue, and the Monk UBAB for lots of attacks.

You know, the crazy Stonehold/Grease/Storm of Vengeance combo :)

Add in Halfling for extra AB, AC, Saving throws and helping reducing multiclass exp penalties having rogue as a favoured class

Because Kamas are 'small weapons' a dual kama halfling will suffer extra AB penalties if I go down that route, but a human or elven version of this build wouldn't suffer from such problems (hmmm) so I haven't gone down the dual kama route but I could I guess...

This guy kinda looks very versatile. Can cast 'undispellable buffs', whole bunch of other spells with UMD, melee attack with a Kama, ranged attack with slings or bows and tank with epic dodge/high AC (further buffed with Owl's Insight), balanced saves with +6 saves against spells/+2 saves against traps/+4 against fear/+2 against mind effects,  a 29 reflex save combined with both improved evasion and deflect arrows and maxed discipline/concentration/40 tumbleand a ridiculous amount of skill points to detect set disable traps and open locks (I dont think my skill schedule is quite the best right now)

Anyway just wanted to gather your thoughts and see if there were suggestions/improvements, I haven't played many rogueish type characters or dex based characters. I figured sneak attack is going to be important to make sure my attacks actually do damage in a Str 8 Dex build.
